alert.note: Alert for Northampton (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 14 at 11:25AM EDT until July 14 at 2:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of northeast North Carolina and Virginia, including the following counties, in northeast North Carolina, Northampton. In Virginia, Brunswick, Greensville and Mecklenburg. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Showers and thunderstorms are expected across the area this afternoon and evening. 1 to 3 inches of rain fell across the watch area this morning. With a very humid airmass in place, heavy rainfall will be possible with any storms that develop today. Given the rain that fell earlier today, a quick 1 to 2 inches of rain could result in flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
